content:
• Monday, December 18, 2017
  • SQM

    Chile's Corfo, SQM seek settlement of mining claims

    • Sociedad Quimica y Minera de Chile (NYSE:SQM) jumped nearly 8% in today's trade, and +2.7% after-hours on news that Chilean development agency Corfo and Pampa Calichera, which controls SQM, agree to suspend their arbitration battle for 30 days as they try to solve a dispute over lithium mining claims.
    • Chile would be able to expand its lithium production "significantly" if the negotiations are successful, Corfo says.
    • SQM surged today with the election of pro-business Sebastian Pinera, who promised to cut corporate taxes and red tape, as president of Chile; the country's GDP averaged just 1.8% over the past four years, down from 5.3% during 2009-13 when Pinera was last in office.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:13 PM | 10 Comments
  • CARS

    Cars.com +8% on Starboard 9.9% active stake disclosure

    • Cars.com (NYSE:CARS) +8.4% after-hours following a disclosure that activist investor Starboard Value LP bought a 9.9% stake in the company.
    • Starboard believes the company is undervalued by a market that is betting heavily against it and ignoring the potential for a sale, WSJ reports.
    • Starboard also sees potential for the online auto marketplace to improve margins when it no longer has to share a large portion of its sales with the media companies that once controlled it, according to the report; Cars.com was spun off from media company Tegna, the former Gannett, in June, which had started the website as a way to pool resources selling online classifieds.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM | 6 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers: STAY +4.9%. APTI +4.7%. INSY +4.3%. NMM +2.1%. HEI +2.1%.
    • Top losers: CIO -3.5%. FRAN -3.5%. AERI -2.5%. MN -1.6%. AFB -1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • DPW

    Digital Power files for mixed shelf

    • Digital Power (NYSEMKT:DPW) files for a mixed shelf of up to $100M.
    • Digital Power shares are down 2.7% aftermarket.
    • Previously: Digital Power files for common stock offering (Dec. 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 13 Comments
  • KTOS

    Kratos announces $27M government contract

    • Kratos Defense & Security Solutions (NASDAQ:KTOS) announces receiving a $27M single-award contract from a U.S. government agency.
    • The contract pertains to unmanned drone systems.
    • No additional terms provided.
    • Kratos shares are up 3.3% aftermarket.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 6 Comments
  • AERI

    FDA OKs Aerie Pharma's Rhopressa for lowering IOP in glaucoma patients

    • As expected, the FDA approves Aerie Pharmaceuticals' (AERI -0.3%) Rhopressa (netarsudil ophthalmic solution) 0.02% for lowering intraocular pressure in patients with open-angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension. The approval came early. The action date (PDUFA) was February 28, 2018.
    • In a unanimous vote in October, an advisory committee backed approval.
    • The company plans to launch the product in mid-Q2 after hiring 100 sales reps next quarter.
    • It also says its U.S. marketing application for Roclatan is on track for Q2 as well.
    • Previously: Ad Com backs Aerie Pharma's Rhopressa for lowering IOP in patients with glaucoma and ocular hypertension (Oct. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 7 Comments
  • OLLI

    Ollie's Bargain Outlet Holdings races to new high

    • Ollie's Bargain Outlet Holdings (NASDAQ:OLLI) jumps 5.50% ahead of an appearance by CEO Mark Butler on CNBC's Mad Money show.
    • Host Jim Cramer has been positive on Ollie's in the past.
    • Shares of Ollie's carved out a new all-time high of $53.25 in earlier trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • GMLP

    Golar LNG Partners +7% as Stifel upgrades to Buy

    • Golar LNG Partners (GMLP +6.5%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $25 price target, raised from $23, at Stifel, which expects the units to strengthen to a yield commensurate with well covered distributions.
    • Stifel downgraded GMLP to Hold last January as a number of LNG and FSRU contracts were rolling off into a weaker market with no line of sight to replacements for the cash flows, but the firm thinks any questions about GMLP's distribution now should be put to rest with the Hilli nearly operational, capital already raised for dropdowns, and what should be a wave of new contracts coming soon.
    • Also, Jefferies assumes coverage of GMLP with a Buy rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 10 Comments
  • COINB

    Bitcoin Cash up almost 15% on Coinbase hopes

    • Coinbase (COINB) earlier today added Bitcoin Cash to its Application Programming Interface (API) before quickly removing it.
    • The move has some excited that the popular exchange is set to begin offering trading in the alt coin (it currently offers just Bitcoin, Ether, and Litecoin). What it may be instead was preparation for an already-advertised plan to begin allowing Bitcoin Cash withdrawals on Jan. 1.
    • BCH is among the larger movers in cryptos today, up 14.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 2 Comments
  • CFX

    Colfax reaffirms 2017 EPS guidance, provides upside view for 2018

    • Colfax (CFX +3.3%) is higher after reaffirming its FY 2017 earnings outlook and providing upside guidance for 2018.
    • In a slide presentation, CFX reaffirms previous guidance for 2017 adjusted EPS of $1.65-$1.75, or $1.37-$1.47 from continuing operations, vs. $1.62 analyst consensus estimate, and issues upside guidance for FY 2018, seeing adjusted EPS of $2.00-$2.15, or $1.65-$1.80 from continuing operations, vs. $1.78 consensus, as well as organic revenue growth between flat and up 2%.
    • CFX also says it is achieving its target of $50M in restructuring cost savings.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • SDRL

    Seadrill gets alternative restructuring proposal from Barclays

    • Seadrill (SDRL -4.4%) says in a court filing that Barclays has submitted an alternative proposal to restructure the company, the third restructuring proposal received after it filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in September; the filing gives no details of Barclays’ plan.
    • One of the proposals - which SDRL calls “the highest and otherwise best value-maximizing alternative” - is from main SDRL owner John Fredriksen and a group of hedge funds, and another is from an “Ad-Hoc Group” of unsecured bondholders including ~40 investors from the U.S., Europe and Asia.
    • A hearing on the official restructuring plan will be held in U.S. Bankruptcy Court in Texas on Jan. 10.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 7 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:55 pm

    • Gainers: OTCPK:LFIN +230%. APPN +23%. MARK +15%. AKAM +14%. MRAM +14%.
    • Losers: OPNT -15%. APDN -10%. GLUU -9%. PTI -9%. MATR -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • RIOT

    Riot Blockchain soars more than 40% as Citron goes short

    • "Full mania," tweets Andrew Left. "No reason to short any stocks now that even have business while the market has given us stocks like RIOT."
    • "The bar for finding good shorts has been lowered."
    • Riot was sharply higher prior to the Citron tweet. It briefly pared some gains, but has returned to up 40%.
    • Left also returns to his short/hedge on OTCQX:GBTC, noting - with the launch of Bitcoin futures on the CME - one can hedge for a 10% premium to the spot price of BTC while GBTC trades for an 80% premium. "Who cares where bitcoin goes..thank you for the 70% profit." GBTC +28% today.
    • Previously: Longfin rocketship still going (Dec. 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM | 221 Comments
  • NE

    Noble Corp. sued by Paragon Offshore in connection with 2014 spinoff

    • Noble Corp. (NE +2.3%) is sued by Paragon Offshore (OTCPK:PGNPQ), which claims the company jettisoned a fleet of old offshore drilling rigs through a fraudulent 2014 spinoff by NE of Paragon Offshore.
    • Paragon claims NE isolated the rigs in a group of subsidiaries it called Paragon Offshore, loaded up Paragon with $1.73B in debt, transferred the proceeds to itself and distributed equity in Paragon to NE shareholders.
    • NE reiterates its view that the spinoff "was a thoughtfully executed strategy... designed to support the success of Paragon by virtue of several important operational and financial factors at the time of the spinoff."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM | 18 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:30 pm

    • Gainers: MPVD +10%. WTI +9%. SQM +9%. AXU +8%. ECR +8%.
    • Losers: SNMX -15%. PER -12%. NAK -11%. HEP -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • OII

    Oceaneering +5% after winning U.S. offshore wind contract

    • Oceaneering International (OII +5.3%) pops higher after winning a contract award from offshore wind developer US Wind for high-resolution marine geophysical surveys next year for the $2.5B Maryland Offshore Wind Project.
    • The project's plans call for installing 187 turbines over ~80K acres, and a substation will collect the energy from the turbines and transmit the electricity to the shore using underwater cables.
    • Maryland Offshore Wind is expected to produce up to 750 MW of power from Ocean City, Md., and is anticipated to come online in early 2020.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM | 2 Comments
  • KLAC

    KeyBanc upgrades "underappreciated" KLA-Tencor

    • KeyBanc upgrades KLA-Tencor (NASDAQ:KLAC) from Sector Weight to Overweight with a $134 price target.
    • Analyst Weston Twigg calls the stock “underappreciated” and poised for a breakout next year as the “relative rate of capital expenditure growth between NAND and logic/foundry normalizes.” 
    • Twigg also predicts strong cash flow, competitor-beating margins, and new products as drivers next year. 
    • KLA-Tencor shares are up 5.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 4 Comments
  • LIXXF

    Lithium X to be bought by Chinese firm for C$265M

    • China’s Nextview New Energy Lion P-E fund agrees to acquire Canadian lithium producer Lithium X (OTCPK:LIXXF +18.5%) for $C265M (US$206M), the latest move by Chinese companies to secure battery raw materials.
    • The $2.61/share takeover price is a 22.5% premium to the stock's closing price on the TSX Venture Exchange on Dec. 15.
    • Lithium X has two lithium projects in Argentina’s Salta province, as well as a stake in Pure Energy Metals, which is developing a lithium project in Nevada.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 53 Comments
  • EQIX

    Equinix pays cash for Australian data center business

    • Equinix (NASDAQ:EQIX) will pay $792M in cash for all of the equity interests in Australian data center business Metronode.
    • The acquisition will strengthen Equinix’s position in the Asia-Pacific region by adding 10 new data centers and four new metros. 
    • Metronode generated $46M in revenue in the 12 months ending in September 30. 
    • Equinix expects the transaction to close in 1H18.   
    • Equinix shares are down 0.11%.    
    • Previously: BAML's confidence in Equinix grows (Dec. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 25 Comments
  • SANM

    Craig-Hallum upgrades Sanmina

    • Craig-Hallum upgrades Sanmina (NASDAQ:SANM) from Hold to Buy with a $44 price target. 
    • Latest analyst recommendations: 1 Outperform and 6 Hold. 
    • Median price target: $39. 
    • Sanmina shares are up 8%.        
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • AEO

    Jefferies lifts PTs on seven mall retailers

      There's another strong read on U.S. holiday retail sales to digest. Jefferies says department store and specialty retail chains are tracking solidly ahead of Q4 expectations. The firm lines up price target boosts on seven separate retail names in response to its mall data analysis.
    • Jefferies PT hikes: American Eagle Outfitters (AEO +4.7%) to $22 from $20, Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF +6.2%) to $17 from $14, Boot Barn (BOOT +6.8%) to $20 from $13, Gap (GPS +2.6%) to $45 from $41, Michael Kors (KORS +1.6%) to $75 from $62, Kohl’s(KSS +3.1%) to $58 from $48, Urban Outfitters (URBN +4.8%) to $40 from $34.
    • Sources: CNBC and Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM | 15 Comments
  • SXT

    Sensient Technologies lower on Off Wall Street note

    • The company is losing market share of mid-tier flavor and fragrance customers, says OWS, forcing it to bring on less profitable lower-tier clients.
    • The restructuring program may not have been a good idea, forcing valuable employees out, and the creation of quality/customer service issues.
    • OWS's price target suggests nearly 30% downside from Friday's close above $75.
    • SXT initially fell sharply on the report. It's bounced since, but is still down 1.1% on the session to $74.90.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • OPNT

    Opiant reports new data supporting heroin vaccine; investors unmoved, shares down 11%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Opiant Pharmaceuticals (OPNT -11.4%) is down on double normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 103K shares, on the heels of its announcement of new preclinical data describing the synthesis of a heroin-like molecule that it says would make it practical to scale up for clinical use.
    • The molecule, an essential component of opioid use disorder candidate OPNT005, produced high levels of antibodies in rodents which bind to heroin and other opioids like oxycodone and hydrocodone, significantly diminishing their effects.
    • The company says it is currently evaluating a potential clinical development program for OPNT005 which it licensed in 2016. It was jointly developed by the Walter Reed Army Institute of Research and the National Institute on Drug Abuse.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 2 Comments
  • BB

    BlackBerry announces BB10 extension, new upgrade program

    • BlackBerry (NYSE:BB) will support its BB10 operating system for at least two more years.
    • But parts of BB10 will depart earlier with the BlackBerry World app store closing on the last day of 2019, BlackBerry Travel site shuttering in February 2018, and the Playbook video calling service following in March.
    • BB10 launched in 2012 and was the company’s second to last proprietary OS followed only by BlackBerry Leap before the switch to Android.
    • The company also announces a new “trade up” program that offers discounts for trading in an older BlackBerry device for a KeyOne or Motion.
    • BlackBerry shares are up 1.4%.
    • Previously: Stocks to watch next week (Dec. 16)
    • Correction: Updated to correct typo.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 19 Comments

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 12:50 PM

    • Gainers: SIEB +21%. GROW +16%. BCH +11%. RCG +9%. BSAC +8%.
    • Losers: MARPS -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • RVVTF

    Revive Therapeutics inks deal with Chemi Pharma to support development of medical cannabis products

    • Revive Therapeutics (OTCQB:RVVTF +0.1%) enters into a collaboration agreement with Canadian cannabis dealer Chemi Pharmaceutical aimed at supporting the development of Revive's medical cannabis portfolio, including its cannabinoid delivery system.
    • Chemi provides a range of quality control analytical testing and R&D services to the pharmaceutical, natural health product, veterinary and cannabis industries.
    • Financial terms are not disclosed.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: OTCPK:LFIN +475%. OTIV +103%. DSS +87%. BETR +71%. MLNK +50%. VIPS +41%. NXTD +42%. HSON +38%. CLNT +30%. APPN +27%.
    • Losers: DAVE -17%. SNMX -15%. VNRX -14%. GLUU -11%. ERII -10%. SALM -10%. JOB -9%. TNTR-OLD -9%. APDN -8%. NAK -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 10 Comments
  • VMW

    KeyBanc upgrades VMware on 2018 prospects

    • KeyBanc upgrades VMware (NYSE:VMW) from Sector Weight to Overweight with a $142 price target.
    • Analyst Alex Kurtz says the business showed strength in renewal rates in 2017 despite the rise of competitors.   
    • Kurtz thinks the current stock price doesn’t reflect VMware’s 2018 prospects. 
    • The analyst outlines a bull case with a price target of $172 that implies 12% blended revenue growth in FY19 with 36% FCF margin and a 20x multiple.
    • VMware shares are up 3.7%.          
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobras secures deal with Japan's Modec for Libra oil platform

    • Petrobras (PBR +2.6%) says it has closed a deal with Japan’s Modec (OTCPK:MDIKF), which will build and operate an oil platform for as many as 17 wells in Brazil’s offshore Libra block.
    • PBR says the floating production, storage and offloading unit will process up to 180K bbl/day of oil and 12M cm/day of gas, with production forecast to begin in 2021.
    • Also, CEO Pedro Parente says he expects Statoil's acquisition of a 25% stake in PBR's Roncador oil field in the Campos Basin for as much as $2.9B will be scrutinized by Brazil’s Federal Court of Accounts, possibly resulting in a delay but "it will not stop the process."
    • Finally, PBR discloses the proposed sale of two units to Mexican petrochemical firm Alpek has received a recommendation for approval from technical staff at Brazil antitrust watchdog Cade.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • BGNE

    Mid-stage study underway assessing BeiGene's PARP inhibitor pamiparib in ovarian cancer; shares ahead 4%

    • BeiGene (BGNE +4.2%) is up on lower-than-normal volume on the heels of its announcement that the first patient has been dosed in a pivotal Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating PARP inhibitor pamiparib (BGB-290) in Chinese patients with advanced BRCA mutation-positive ovarian cancer who have received at least two prior lines of therapy.
    • The primary endpoint is objective response rate (ORR) as determined by independent radiology review.
    • No PARP inhibitor has been approved in China to date. Two have been approved in the U.S.: Clovis Oncology's Rubraca (rucaparib) and TESARO's ZEJULA (niraparib).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMZN

    JPMorgan raises price targets for Amazon, Facebook, and Priceline

    • JPMorgan raises Amazon’s (NASDAQ:AMZN) price target to $1,375.
    • Analyst Doug Anmuth cites Amazon’s dominance as an e-tailer and estimates that Amazon Web Services holds about 75% of the U.S. public cloud market. 
    • Anmuth also raised Facebook’s (NASDAQ:FB) price target to $225 and Priceline’s (PCLN) to $2,050.   
    • Amazon shares are up 1%. 
    • Facebook shares are up 0.2%. 
    • Priceline shares are up 1.3%.   
    • Previously: Twitter +5% after JPMorgan upgrade (Dec. 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM | 28 Comments
  • BHP

    Iron ore, steel names on the move as iron ore futures jump most in a month

    • BHP Billiton (BHP +1.6%), Rio Tinto (RIO +1.7%), Vale (VALE +3.1%) and Fortescue Metals (OTCQX:FSUMF +1.4%) are all higher after iron ore futures surged 5.5%, the most in a month, on the Dalian Commodity Exchange, while the benchmark price for spot ore delivered to Qingdao jumped 3.7% to $74.15/dry ton, the highest since September.
    • “Tighter supply of some material has bolstered prices in the short term,” says Chinese brokerage Shanghai Cifco Futures, as China's environmental cleanup tightens the supply of higher-grade material that is less polluting and allows steelmakers to maximize production.
    • Also higher: X +4.1%, MT +3.1%, WOR +2.4%, AKS +2.3%, STLD +2.1%, CLF +1.9%, NUE +1.7%, RS +1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM | 23 Comments
  • NVCR

    Novocure on go to start late-stage study of Optune in pancreatic cancer; shares up 3%

    • The FDA has signed off on a Phase 3 clinical trial, PANOVA 3, assessing Novocure's (NVCR +3.3%) Optune, along with chemo agents nab-paclitaxel and gemcitabine, for the first-line treatment of unresectable locally advanced pancreatic cancer.
    • The primary endpoint of the 556-subject study is overall survival.
    • Optune is a non-invasive device that creates alternating "wave-like" electric fields called Tumor Treating Fields (TTFields). Study participants will receive treatment for at least 18 hours each day tuned to 150 kHz until the cancer progresses.
    • PANOVA 3 is the company's third late-stage study beyond glioblastoma.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM | 4 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: OTIV +79%. BETR +70%. NVFY +16%. FTFT +14%. AKO-B +13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • LFIN

    Longfin rocketship still going

    • To review, Longfin (OTCPK:LFIN) a few days back was a rather lackluster fintech IPO. Shares, however, exploded on Friday on announcement of the purchase of a blockchain company.
    • The stock's more than tripled again today, now selling for $82.45 each vs. about $5 prior to the acquisition announcement.
    • Previously: LongFin latest name to boom on blockchain (Dec. 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 143 Comments
  • SSKN

    STRATA Skin to explore strategic options; shares ahead 12%

    • STRATA Skin Sciences (SSKN +11.6%) has started the process of exploring strategic alternatives, including the potential sale of the company.
    • CEO Frank McCaney says, “We believe we have made significant progress in developing our products and continue to implement changes to our business with the goal of enhancing our strategic position in the medical and aesthetic dermatology market.  We believe now is the appropriate time to explore strategic alternatives.”
     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • BRK.A

    Berkshire Hathaway tops $300K per share

    • Just more than 55 years after Warren Buffett purchased his first shares (2K) of Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE:BRK.A) for $7.50 each, the stock moments ago topped $300K. That roughly 4,000,000% increase is a move even Bitcoin #hodlers would be impressed with.
    • Prior to starting giving away chunks of his holdings to charity in 2006, Buffett's stake in Berkshire had topped 30%. Today he owns about 17%, worth roughly $85B.
    • Maybe most interesting about the current state of Buffett/Berkshire ... Some bull market geniuses of today are wondering if the The Oracle has lost his touch. The last time we heard that sort of talk was just prior to the spectacular bursting of the Internet/telco bubble in 2000.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 60 Comments
  • NTGR

    Raymond James upgrades NetGear

    • Raymond James upgrades NetGear (NASDAQ:NTGR) from Market Perform to Outperform with a $62 price target.
    • NetGear shares are up 5.4% to $58.35. 
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • AYTU

    New finance chief at Aytu Bio; shares ahead 6%

    • Aytu BioScience (AYTU +6.1%) appoints David Green as Chief Financial Officer effective today. Previously he was Chief Accounting Officer at Intarcia Therapeutics.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • ATVI

    BTIG initiates Activision Blizzard

    • BTIG initiates coverage on Activision Blizzard (NASDAQ:ATVI) with a Buy rating and $80 price target.
    • Analyst Brandon Ross says he is bullish on the gaming sector since publishers have used tech to transform games. Ross cites Activision as best in sector. 
    • BTIG rates Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) at Neutral and Take-Two (NASDAQ:TTWO) at Buy with a $142 price target.   
    • Activision shares are down 0.3%. 
    • Electronic Arts shares are down 1.7%. 
    • Take-Two shares are down 0.9%.    
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 40 Comments
  • STCN

    ModusLink announces acquisition of IWCO Direct; Shares +45%

    • ModusLink Global Solutions (MLNK +46.3%) and Steel Partners Holdings (SPLP +0.3%) announced that ModusLink has completed the acquisition of privately-held IWCO Direct, a leading provider of data-driven direct marketing solutions, for $476M in cash. IWCO Direct becomes a wholly-owned subsidiary of ModusLink Global Solutions.
    • IWCO Direct had net revenue of $470.6M, net income of $18.9M and EBITDA of $82.2M (Last 12 months through Oct. 2017).
    • The acquisition was funded through cash and debt financing provided by Cerberus Business Finance as the administrative agent and collateral agent, and consists of a term loan in the principal amount of $393.0M and a borrowing in the amount of up to $25.0M under a revolving credit facility.
    • Additionally, it was announced today that Steel Partners Holdings increased its investment in ModusLink through its affiliate SPH Group Holdings, LLC, with a $35.0M convertible preferred stock investment, which together with its affiliates, brings its beneficial ownership in ModusLink to ~52%.
    • Warren Lichtenstein, Executive Chairman of ModusLink, said, "We have been looking to acquire a profitable business with attractive operations and financials, and with a strong management team in order to leverage our ~$2.1B in net operating loss carryforwards (NOLs) and cash. We found a great fit in IWCO Direct. We essentially double the size of our Company and add significant earnings and free cash flow. We add a market leader with industry-leading solutions, a client base consisting of Fortune 500 companies, and significant opportunities to drive both top- and bottom-line results. We intend to aggressively grow IWCO Direct, organically and through acquisitions, and will look to leverage Steel Partners' vast relationships and resources to drive operational excellence and enhance stakeholder value."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 4 Comments
  • SCG

    Scana -4% as report suggests federal, state probe into failed nuclear project

    • Scana (SCG -3.8%) sinks following a report that federal agents are investigating whether it failed to reveal material information about the failed V.C. Summer nuclear project to investors, and whether its actions constitute fraud or general securities violations, according to The State newspaper.
    • The report details a February 2016 conference call in which top company execs explained why the construction contract protected the V.C. Summer project from a contractor’s financial problems while failing to disclose that it had received a critical report just two weeks earlier that examined problems that could doom the project.
    • The SEC has subpoenaed records from the company and at least six FBI agents may be working on the case, while as many as six South Carolina Law Enforcement Division agents are looking into the matter in a separate state investigation, according to the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 12 Comments
  • NVIV

    New chief at InVivo; shares up 3%

    • InVivo Therapeutics Holdings (NVIV +2.9%) appoints Chief Medical Officer Richard Toselli, M.D., as acting CEO replacing Mark Perrin who resigned.
    • Mr. Perrin has agreed to serve as a consultant for six months.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 9 Comments
  • JBL

    Argus upgrades Jabil

    • Argus upgrades Jabil (NYSE:JBL) from Hold to Buy.
    • The upgrade follows last week’s Q1 earnings beat.
    • Jabil shares are down 1.6%.         
    • Previously: Jabil +4.6% after Q1 beats, in-line and better guidance (Dec. 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM | 4 Comments
  • AIPT

    Skyline Medical up 8% on Australian OK of Streamway

    • Thinly traded nano cap Skyline Medical (SKLN +8.4%) is up on over 20% higher volume in apparent response to the approval of its STREAMWAY medical fluid disposal system in Australia.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 5 Comments
  • OCLR

    Needham downgrades Oclaro

    • Needham & Company downgrades Oclaro (NASDAQ:OCLR) from Buy to Hold.
    • Analyst Alex Henderson says the limited growth potential negates what looks like an inexpensive stock. 
    • Oclaro shares are down 2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM | 20 Comments
  • E

    Eni restarts Goliat production, reportedly begins Zohr start-up process

    • Eni (E +1.7%) says it has resumed production from Norway’s Arctic Goliat oilfield following a two-month outage, and plans to explore for more resources in the area.
    • Eni says it carried out extensive planned maintenance and modifications at Goliat as well as work related to the platform’s electrical system following intervention by Norwegian authorities; Norway's Petroleum Safety Authority said 10 days ago that Eni could bring back onstream the 100K bbl/day field, which had been shut at the agency’s order since Oct. 6 after suffering a series of safety incidents and production shutdowns since its startup in 2016.
    • Eni also has started production at its Zohr gas field development offshore Egypt, according to the country's petroleum minister, who says initial production is 350M cf/day, to increase to ~1B cf/day by mid-2018 upon completion of the first phase of development.
    • Zohr, the Mediterranean’s largest gas discovery, is expected to reach production of 2.7B cf/day once fully developed.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
